trans-unit.source: The exception thrown when an error occurs during serialization or deserialization.
<xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException> uses the `HRESULT` COR_E_SERIALIZATION with the value 0x8013150C.
<xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException> uses the default <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> implementation, which supports reference equality.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException>, see the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException.%23ctor%2A> constructors.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException"></xref> class with default properties.
<xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException> inherits from the <xref:System.SystemException> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException> initialized with the current constructor.
Property
Condition
Localized error message for <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException"></xref> class with a specified message.
<xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException> inherits from the <xref:System.SystemException> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException> initialized with the current constructor.
Property
Condition
The `message` string.
Indicates the reason why the exception occurred.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException"></xref> class from serialized data.
The current constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
(For more information on serialization see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md).)
The serialization information object holding the serialized object data in the name-value form.
The contextual information about the source or destination of the exception.
The info parameter is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException>.
Property
Value
The inner exception reference.
The error message string.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the innerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
